title: Iowa prison officials say inmates brawl at Fort Dodge prison
title_page: Iowa prison officials say inmates brawl at Fort Dodge prison
maintext:
FORT DODGE, Iowa (AP) — Guards at a Fort Dodge prison were able to quickly gain control of melee that broke out between two groups of inmates, according to Iowa prison officials.
The Iowa Department of Corrections said in a news release that the fight broke out Thursday morning in the main yard of the Fort Dodge Correctional Facility. The brawling inmates initially refused commands to stop, the release said, so staff used pepper spray to break up the fight. Officials said that while those inmates were being restrained, a second smaller fight broke out between two other groups of inmates in front of a different living unit. Officials said staff were able stop that brawl using verbal commands.
In all, 14 inmates were involved in the two incidents, officials said. No serious injuries were reported.
